categories.description: Examining our relationship with God and adherence to the First Three Commandments

subcategories.name: Faith and Belief
subcategories.description: Our fundamental relationship with God and His Church

sins.question: Did I deny or doubt God's existence?
sins.details: Knowingly and willfully rejecting the existence of God is a grave violation of faith. This sin undermines the relationship with the Creator and is contrary to the First Commandment.

sins.question: Did I refuse to believe God's revelation?
sins.details: Refusing to accept the truths revealed by God, particularly those taught by the Church, is a serious offense. This includes rejection of dogmas or essential teachings.

sins.question: Did I deny that I was a Catholic?
sins.details: Publicly denying one's Catholic faith, especially out of fear or shame, is a grave sin. It is a form of apostasy or scandal and fails to witness to Christ.

subcategories.name: Worship and Prayer
subcategories.description: Our participation in divine worship and prayer life

sins.question: Did I miss Mass on a Sunday or Holy Day of Obligation?
sins.details: Deliberately missing Mass without a serious reason (illness, caregiving, etc.) breaks the Third Commandment and is gravely sinful.

sins.question: Was I voluntarily inattentive at Mass?
sins.details: Distraction at Mass is a common human weakness, but deliberately choosing not to pay attention shows lack of devotion.

sins.question: Did I receive Communion in a state of mortal sin?
sins.details: Receiving the Eucharist while conscious of being in a state of mortal sin is itself a mortal sin. One must first receive sacramental confession.

subcategories.name: Reverence and Respect
subcategories.description: Our respect for God's name and sacred things

sins.question: Did I blaspheme or take God's name in vain?
sins.details: Using God's name disrespectfully, especially in oaths or blasphemy, is a serious offense against the Second Commandment.

sins.question: Did I engage in superstitious practices?
sins.details: Turning to occult practices and superstition demonstrates a lack of trust in God's providence and can open one to spiritual deception.

categories.description: Examining our duties toward family members and those in authority

sins.question: Did I disobey or disrespect my parents or legitimate superiors?
sins.details: Deliberate and persistent disobedience or disrespect toward one's parents or rightful authorities is a grave violation of the Fourth Commandment.

sins.question: Did I neglect my duties to my spouse, children, or parents?
sins.details: Failing to fulfill familial duties—such as providing emotional, physical, or spiritual care—can gravely damage family unity.

categories.description: Examining our respect for human life and dignity

sins.question: Did I physically injure or kill anyone?
sins.details: Harming or taking the life of another human being, outside of legitimate self-defense, is a direct offense against the Fifth Commandment.

sins.question: Have I had an abortion, or advised or supported an abortion?
sins.details: Abortion ends the life of an innocent human being and is a mortal sin. Supporting or encouraging abortion is also gravely sinful.

sins.question: Did I willfully entertain impure thoughts?
sins.details: Willfully dwelling on impure thoughts or desires, especially for arousal, is a grave sin against chastity.

categories.description: Examining our honesty and fairness in dealings with others

sins.question: Did I steal or deliberately damage another's property?
sins.details: Taking or damaging what belongs to others violates justice. The gravity depends on value and harm caused.

sins.question: Did I tell serious lies or deliberately deceive others?
sins.details: Lying with intent to seriously harm others or mislead in grave matters is mortally sinful.

categories.description: Examining our love for God and neighbor

sins.question: Did I harbor hatred or resentment?
sins.details: Deliberate hatred is contrary to charity. Harboring resentment can lead to serious sin.

sins.question: Did I refuse to forgive others?
sins.details: Refusing to forgive others while seeking God's forgiveness is a serious contradiction.

sins.question: Did I ignore the needs of the poor when I could have helped?
sins.details: Deliberately ignoring those in extreme need when able to help is a serious sin of omission.
